info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 12 at 4:47PM EDT until August 12 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg VA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of southwest Virginia, including the following counties, Carroll, Grayson and Wythe.
* WHEN...Until 615 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 447 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Cripple Creek, Dean Branch, Chestnut Creek, Cold Run, Dry Run, Big Reed Island Creek, Cedar Run, Crooked Creek, Dungeon Branch, Cranberry Creek, Bull Run, Buddle Branch and Brush Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fries... Patterson... Speedwell... Ivanhoe... Byllesby... Coleman Store... Woodlawn... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on X.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Carroll, VA; Grayson, VA; Wythe, VA
